description.narrative: The Compagnie Ivoirienne pour le Dévelopement des Textiles (CIDT, the Company) is a cotton ginning company in Cote dIvoire (CDI) which is headquartered in Bouaké, the second largest city of the country. The company transforms raw cotton (seed cotton) into cotton lint/fiber which is mainly exported. The seed cotton is acquired from more than 30,000 smallholder farmers active in his exclusive area. IFCs financing will be used to support CIDTs expansion plan in CDI (the Project) for: (i) Building a new 40,000 mtpa ginning plant in Tieningboué to increase the Companys ginning capacity:; (ii) Upgrading its running plants in Bouaké, Mankono and Séguela; (iii) financing transport equipment which will improve the companys operations and reduce reliance on third party.

The most significant expected Project-level outcomes are: (i) processing internally what is currently outsourced to 2 other processing ginneries; (ii) generating additional resources and expand farmer support to increase productivity since their interest is aligned with those of the farmers: the higher the volume, the better the margin since price is fixed and therefore not a lever of their profitability; (iii) searching for new sources of procurement, outside the contractual zones, and therefore reaching an additional segment of farmers who will benefit from increased incomes from producing cotton. The stakeholder effects for farmers will be enhanced through the provision of Advisory Services focused on capacity building and improved agricultural practices. Beyond the project level, IFC expects the investment to improve competitiveness in the cotton sector through strong demonstration and replication effects, largely at the processing and primary production levels. Capacity building of farmers will motivate processors in other zones to replicate similar practices with their suppliers.
